abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of the Roads
            and Bridges Management and Maintenance Program Project for
            Mozambique were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Ratings for
            the Railways and Ports Restructuring Project for Mozambique
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk
            to development outcome was moderate; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory; and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned include: 1)
            precise definition and scheduling of works during project
            preparation; 2) policy and institutional reforms undertaken
            prior to major investments in works; 3) participatory
            approach to reflect changing priorities in strategy updates;
            4) appropriate financial management systems established to
            guarantee accountability and transparency; 5) strengthened
            procurement capacity; and 6) the use of local contractors as
            capacity is built. Of these lessons, perhaps the one
            embedded the most in the project design was the use of a
            participatory approach to continuously reflect changing
            priorities in strategy updates.
